title: The Instagram Gradient: Killing Skeuomorphism
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Instagram Gradient: Killing Skeuomorphism.

hook.text: In 2016, Instagram replaced its beloved retro camera icon with a flat gradient. The internet lost its mind.

buildup.text: The old logo was a realistic Polaroid camera â€” warm, nostalgic, and deeply loved by users.

discovery.text: The new gradient icon was simpler, more scalable, and matched the app's evolution beyond just photos.

twist.text: User outrage lasted two weeks. Then everyone forgot the old logo. That's how rebrands always work.

climax.text: Instagram proved that brand evolution matters more than brand nostalgia.

punchline.text: Users hate every rebrand. Then they accept it. Every time.

quiz.question: What was the public reaction to Instagram's 2016 logo change?
options: Initial outrage followed by quick acceptance
